intro: Memecylon urdanetense, commonly known as the UrdaNet hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, pentamerous flowers that typically display vibrant colors. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
